metadata.Title: CVE-2018-11040 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Spring Framework, versions 5.0.x prior to 5.0.7 and 4.3.x prior to 4.3.18 and older unsupported versions, allows web applications to enable cross-domain requests via JSONP (JSON with Padding) through AbstractJsonpResponseBodyAdvice for REST controllers and MappingJackson2JsonView for browser requests. Both are not enabled by default in Spring Framework nor Spring Boot, however, when MappingJackson2JsonView is configured in an application, JSONP support is automatically ready to use through the "jsonp" and "callback" JSONP parameters, enabling cross-domain requests.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-11040` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libspring-aop-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-beans-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-context-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-context-support-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-core-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-expression-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-instrument-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-jdbc-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-jms-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-messaging-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-orm-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-oxm-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-test-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-transaction-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-web-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-web-portlet-java - 4.3.19-1
libspring-web-servlet-java - 4.3.19-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libspring-java package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.3.19-1').
